intro: Lannea ruspollii, commonly known as the African tallow tree, is a member of the Anacardiaceae family and is native to eastern and southern Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by orange-red, fleshy fruits. Its leaves are alternate and pinnate, with each leaflet being elliptical in shape. Lannea ruspollii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
